text: BACKGROUND : Platelet / endothelium interaction plays an important role in the pathophysiology of inflammation and atherosclerosis .

The role of platelets for <extra_id_0> monocyte chemotactic protein-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) secretion and surface expression of <extra_id_0> intercellular adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) on endothelial cells has been assessed .

text: METHODS AND RESULTS : Monolayers of human umbilical vein endothelial cells were incubated with nonstimulated or ADP - activated platelets for 6 hours , and secretion of <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and surface expression of <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were determined by ELISA and flow cytometry , respectively .

text: In the presence of ADP - activated platelets , both <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion and <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> surface expression were significantly increased compared with nonstimulated platelets ( P < 0.02 ) .

text: Activation of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB ( NF-kappaB ) determined by electrophoretic mobility shift assay and kappaB - dependent transcriptional activity was enhanced in the presence of activated platelets .
In addition , ADP - activated platelets induced <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter - dependent transcription .

Liposomal transfection of a double-stranded kappaB phosphorothioate oligonucleotide , but not of the mutated form , inhibited <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion and surface expression of <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on activated endothelium ( P < 0.05 ) .

text: CONCLUSIONS : The present study indicates that activated platelets modulate chemotactic ( <extra_id_0> MCP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and adhesive ( <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) properties of endothelial cells via an NF-kappaB - dependent mechanism .

text: Platelet - induced activation of the NF-kappaB system might contribute to early inflammatory events in atherogenesis .
